page.title: 09School Rose Queen Newcastle
page.content: St.Giles' and St.George's school Rose Queen is elected by her classmates from the last year of the infants school.The coronation in the Queen's gardens is followed by a concert in what is a big day for a 7 year old. This year's Queen,Sally Royle,writes:" When I was Rose Queen I was embarrassed but I liked it.My dress was designed by the lady down Barracks Road.I enjoyed the concert.I liked the costumes the children were wearing.The concert was very good." Lesley Sigley (1984) felt very proud to be the Queen of the school as she led her retinue around the gardens.Nioka Dean (1983)was amazed to be elected. Heather Kuduk (1982) was very nervous. Sarah Pitt (1981) enjoyed it but complained that she had to stand throughout the concert.
